topics.body:
Wanna see something cool?
Here's Norfolk and Western 611. A very fancy 4-8-4 streamlined steam locomotive.
!http://i2.cdn.turner.com/money/dam/assets/150129150917-611-780x439.jpg!

It hasn't been seen in action on the mainline since the mid 1990s. It's been well-preserved, but on static display at the Virginia Museum of Transportation. Shame, since it's one of the most well-made steam locomotives ever built, and quite powerful and fast. That, and it's also a very sexy locomotive.

...That is, until it got taken out around 2014, and has been under restoration until May this year, thanks to a successful fundraiser in 2013, and plenty of available and dedicated volunteers.

!http://www.northeastrailfans.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/05/NW-611.jpg!
This was taken back in 1992, when it was still in service.

"*Here's it of one of its first test-runs on the mainline for the first time in over 15-20 years.*":https://youtu.be/Eem6d0l0FhM?t=2m12s
